intro: Kyllinga alba subsp. nigritana, commonly known as white spikerush, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, white or pale pink flowers that appear in dense spikes. It typically grows in wet or moist soils, such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of water bodies. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
